description:
You open your eyes to discover the most horrible truth of a lifetime... It has just come to an end and you are a ghost, floating in the air! Terrified, you look at your own body. A group of strange individuals have gathered around your mortal remains, watching it closely with sparks of fascination in their eyes. They want to communicate with you to discover how your life ended. You need to talk to them and reveal the truth so the culprit can be judged!

Paranormal Detectives  is a deduction party game. One player takes the role of a Ghost. All other players work as Paranormal Detectives and need to discover how the victim died. Using paranormal abilities they will communicate with the Ghost, asking open questions about the details of the crime. The Ghost answers in a variety of ghostly ways - by arranging a hangman’s knot, playing chosen tarot cards, creating a word puzzle on a talking board, drawing by holding the hand of a detective and many more!

At the beginning of the game, the Ghost player receives a story card with a full description of the murder. Each card depicts all the details of the case. Each Detective receives asymmetrical, pre-constructed set of interaction cards, player investigation sheet, and a player screen.

On their turn, each Detective asks the Ghost any open question they want and plays a single interaction card. The card implies the way the Ghost may answer the question. There are 9 different interactions total, most of them giving information to all Detectives. Since Detectives may ask any open questions and interaction cards vary, the game allows for lots of creativity for both the Ghost and Paranormal Detectives.

Detectives may try, twice during the game, to guess what has actually happened to the victim stating who was the killer, where did it happen, what was the motive, how was it done and what was the murder weapon. Then the Ghost writes down secretly on this Detective’s investigation sheet how many of their answers are correct.

The game can end in two ways: 

     If a Detective gives all correct answers. In this case, they win, together with the Ghost player.
     If all Detectives run out of interaction cards. In this case, if no one has guessed everything correctly then, whoever guessed correctly the most information is the sole winner of the game!


Note: The rulebook includes a fully cooperate variant.

Cleared to Land is an exciting and dynamic card game. The objective of the game is to be the first to get rid of all your cards. The first player to get rid of all their cards has won the round. The remaining players count the value of the cards left in their hand, and the amount is allocated to the winner of the round as victory points. When a player has 500 victory points or more, the game is over. That player has won the game.

—description from the publisher

The Hundred Years War rages on; the English are laying siege to Orléans, a strategic city between the north and the south of the Loire, between those territories annexed by the English and those held by the French Dauphin.

Despite the English forces, Joan of Arc manages to get into the city. The inhabitants and the troops rally around her. You are one of Joan of Arc’s Companions, like Dunois, De Laval and La Hire, and your aim is to distinguish yourself as much as possible during this battle.

Show yourself around enemy fortresses, confer with Joan or the Dauphin, deploy your troops and be ready when Joan launches her attack.

Aim of the game:
You are Joan’s Companions and your common enemy are the English. To liberate the fortresses, you will need to cooperate.
But you need to know that only one will be the winner : The Companion who gathers the more prestige during the battle.
He will have the great honor to accompany Joan and the Dauphin to Reims for the coronation.
So be vigilant, place your troops at the right place and at the right time to shine more and acquire more prestige than the other Companions.

—description from the rulebook

Deliver the goods to the villages nearby the Ulanga River. Sail the steamboats that go down the river everyday avoiding the risks of the Eastern Africa.

Before starting, players must create a river with all river tiles.

The game is played by turns. Each player must play a Movement (At the end of the movement, if any player has a Port card matching the port the boat just stop in, they may discard that card to draw a Scoring 2 points) or Restriction card in order to disturb another player's movement (If a player cannot play any card, they must flip one of their Anchor tokens over, losing 3 points).

The game ends when a player loses their 3 anchors or the last Scoring token is drawn. The player with the most points is the winner.

-description from publisher

The three Great Pyramids of the pharaohs of the Fourth Dynasty were built on the Giza Plateau. Besides, there were other structures destined to other members of the reigning family: Mastabas and Hypogea.

You and your group have just discovered a new mastaba and you are about to explore it. The first thing you find is a painting with three deities forming a triangle. You start to go forward when you also find a very complex mechanisms, which lead you to new chambers. Somehow, it seems everything is connected.

Each turn, the active player opens the access to a new chamber by manipulating the complex mechanisms from the chamber they are in. That player must choose a card from their hand, which will appear in the tomb, and moves their explorer to try to get treasures.

Players must place a card partially over 1 or 2 cards on the table. The deity of the played card must be able to beat at least one of the other deities from the cards it’s touching. If the new card is placed over 2 cards with the same symbol, win 1 treasure.

Then, move the Explorer pawn as many times as the played card indicates. If the movement ends on a card with the same coloured deity symbol as the played card, win 1 treasure

The goal is to get out with the maximum number of treasures. The game ends:

A) When one of the explorer reaches the Exit card. The other players remove 1 treasure point for every card on their way to reach the Exit card.

B) Or when the last card of the deck is drawn.

-description from publisher

Crazy Burger is a game about making hamburgers and stopping other players from doing the same.

OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME:
The first player to get a full set of seven cards featuring all hamburger ingredients wins the game.

CARDS:
There are 7 ingredient cards and 10 special cards. Each card is in the deck 6 times. Players begin with a starting hand of 7 cards.

GENERAL RULES:
At the beginning of each turn take a card, either from the deck or from the top of the discard pile. If the player doesn’t want to draw a card they can pass.

At the beginning of a turn, a player may draw a card from the draw pile or the discard pile. Then they can play cards from their hands. The special cards are used to attack other players, mostly forcing them to discard or give away hand cards. A player who loses their last hand card is eliminated from the game.

Seven Days to the River Rhine is a set of fast play rules simulating armoured combat during the 1980's in Europe when the Cold War between the NATO alliance and Soviet led Warsaw Pact could easily have turned Hot.

The rules cater for games with lots of armour and infantry and other supporting weapons in any scale. The mechanics are remarkably simple and the method of activation presents players with tricky tactical decisions to ponder creating a sense of high tension and drama.

The rules cater for figures or vehicle models of scales between 1/300 6mm and 1/56 28mm.

-description from designer

The design of the Koi ponds may have a great effect on the Nishikigoi’s health and well-being. The Emperor has chosen you to build perfectly suitable ponds, so the carps can reach their highest potential. To do so, you must assign each Koi colony its proper place.

In each round, players have to cooperate assigning a different group of carps splitting the pond. It’s important to optimise the area to shelter the most colonies.

In turn you need to build the perfect home to the colony.

First, determine the perfect pond rolling the 3 dice. These dice show you the exact number of nishikigoi you must have inside a pond area when it’s closed.

To shape the pond, each player must play a Pond card (placed partially other cards) in turn order until a pond area is completely (the wather lilies line is closed). To do so, the card can be partially placed over other cards in play (never underneath).

When the pond is closed, if the exact number of nishikigoi of each colour matches the dice, remove 5 of the played cards and put them at the bottom of the deck. The rest are set aside to show you have built a perfect pond area.

The game ends when all cards have been played. There is no more space in the imperial pond and it’s time to evaluate how well you have done.

—description from the publisher

Players need to choose their passengers and try them to have a pleasant trip in this new social network… Or maybe, they will do anything to make this trip a nightmarish experience.

Each turn begins with an event (station card, then each player may perform 3 actions in the order they prefer. The actions are the following:

A) Get in: Place a passenger from your hand on an empty seat in the train. Then, place on them one of your meeples and the number of likes according to the seat. Also, place dislikes on the adjacent passengers according to the played passenger.

B) Act: Activate the ability of one of your passengers.

C) Draw: Draw 2 cards from the Passenger deck.

When a passenger has 5 cubes, the player who controls them scores immediately: Return to the supply all the dislikes and the same number of likes. Leave the rest in your supply.

The game ends when the last card of the Event deck is drawn and the player with the most likes is the winner.

—description from the publisher

The game Solidarisk aims to raise awareness of business creation and the social and solidarity economy through the CIGALES (Club d'Investisseurs pour une Gestion Alternative et Locale de l'Épargne Solidaire) venture capital investment club. During the game, each team (from 2 to 4 people) plays the role of members of a CIGALES club that will decide whether or not to support the business projects submitted to them. Companies created or supported will be faced with the various hazards of the economic world (crisis, unemployment, competition, innovation, regulation etc.), which will spark debate between all players and require choices from them.

All aspects of the economic life of a company are thus brushed aside in a fun way and can be the means for the entrepreneur to rebound, develop and bring knowledge to the players.

The game is based on real business projects.

The game Solidarisk was created in 1999 by the Fédération des CIGALES on the initiative of AESOPUS, a European program, and has been reissued in partnership with the University of Poitiers.

—user summary

Zero Seven is a psychological quiz game where you need to answer correctly the questions that mostly begin with the words «How many...». Any answer must be a whole number from 0 to 7, and the players bid for the number they consider correct with a combination of their number cards so that their sum equals the estimated answer. The players can’t use bidding cards they’ve placed as bets before, so they have to plan carefully which cards they should keep and which ones they are ready to sacrifice to get the full hand back. There is also an “Elementary!” rule which allows to profit from all other players answering correctly. Most of the times the winner is not the one who reads a lot of books, but the one who is the most cunning!

—description from the publisher

A statistical simulation game by Roberto Chiavini focusing on the Snooker World Championships.  Initial releases allow replaying of the 1927-30 championships, or the 1977-80 championships.

Every player in the competition is rated with an Effectiveness value (representing points scored through the tournament) and a Tournament rating (representing how far the player advanced, and providing the opportunity for bonus dice each round.)

Each frame players tests their Tournament rating, then throw a number of 10-sided dice based on that result.  The total showing on the dice is added to the Effectiveness value and the higher total wins the frame.

"DAMOS: Army Group North" is game 1 of the Barbarossa trilogy of wargames from our new Destroy All Monsters Operational Series (DAMOS) that can be combined together as a mini-monster. Each game by itself is a straight forward operational simulation of each theater, and all 3 games share the exact same rules allowing for easy integration. Units are Divisions along with Army HQs and some Air Units.

DAMOS is a highly interactive and unique, original take on operational/strategic maneuvers during WW2. There is almost 0 player downtime for either player. DAMOS brings mechanics such as combat postures, reactions, and exploitation into the 21st century with a brand new take on some old favorite mechanics.

Army Group North covers Von Leeb’s ascent into the Baltic states in his attempt to blitzkrieg Leningrad. While performing extraordinarily well, a long drawn out siege resulted which eventually led to a German withdraw. AGN gives players the chance to do one better than Von Leeb, with the other two games in the series, the player may even borrow a Panzergruppe or 2 from AGC…

WEIGHT: 5/10

SOLITAIRE: 6/10

PLAYERS: 1-2, up to 6 players with AGC and AGS

—description from the designer

"DAMOS: Army Group Center" is a World War II wargame, issue 2 of the Barbarossa trilogy of wargames that can be combined together as a mini-monster. Each game by itself is a straight forward operational simulation of each theater, and all 3 games share the exact same rules allowing for easy integration. Units are divisions along with army HQs and some air units.

DAMOS is a brand new, unique take on operational scale WW2 gaming that features almost 0 player downtime. DAMOS takes tried and true wargaming conventions and repackage them forcing longtime grognards to re-approach how they think of operational tactics. Units can react, choose combat postures, and get huge exploit opportunities when they overkill an enemy.

Army Group Center covers Von Bock’s relentless drive on Moscow. Logistics must be maintained as the German army advances while the Soviets must stem the flow of Panzers as best as possible. The German player has the choice of sending a Panzer Army south as Hitler ordered historically, or keep them with AGC as the generals wanted in order to take Moscow.

WEIGHT: 6/10

SOLITAIRE: 6/10

PLAYERS: 1-2, up to 6 players with AGN and AGS.

—description from the designer

1995 is the third iteration of our Procedural Combat Series and it examines a cold war gone hot during the Yugoslavian wars of succession. The combined might of a Serb dominated JNA and a weakened but still potent Russia move on the smaller republics in an attempt to establish A Serb dominated Yugoslavia giving Russia a foothold in NATO’s backyard.

PCS is an easy to learn, but difficult to master rules-system. Instead of Combat values, unit's are printed with a Unit Quality Rating and a Movement Allowance. Combat strength is determined randomly based on unit quality, and positioning before an attacking. The result is an original system which focuses like a laser on the unpredictability of cold war-era combat.

The OOB includes a well-researched collection of available divisions and air assets. The Russian OOB is based off the militia which attacked Grozny in 1994. The JNA is accurately represented though assumed to be at full strength. Numerous other Balkan and NATO nations are represented. 1995 focuses more on maneuver and less on chrome as there are no special counters, but lots of units instead.

WEIGHT: 7/10
SOLITAIRE: 9/10
PLAYERS: 1-2

—description from the designer

Players are working in a company which is in trouble, and they fear the next round of layoffs. To increase their chances to keep their job, they start sabotaging their coworkers' health by inviting them to a nearby "boteco", a kind of pub with disgusting food and questionable cleaning. By stuffing their beloved colleagues with horrible food, they try to damage their organs. This is done by playing food cards on them. 
Players get points for the food they eat, but if they eat too much, they might die. When the first player has died, the player with most victory points wins.

—user summary

When will you take the throne?

A slew of villains threaten Wakanda! As the five tribes of Wakanda, battle together to keep the country safe. Leading the fight is the King of Wakanda and ultimate warrior, the Black Panther, who alone earns more points than the other four tribes — but you want the throne for yourself, so time your moves carefully, challenge for the throne when the moment is right, and take the mantle of Black Panther! Win the game with the most points and cement your legacy as the Black Panther.

In Wakanda Forever, each tribe has a bonus power to begin the game, and additional powers are earned by whoever holds the Black Panther title when a villain is defeated. Choose to use your valuable Vibranium to upgrade your tech with the chance to score more points, or save it to enter a one-on-one ceremonial battle for the throne.

—description from the publisher

ARTBOX is a game in which each player becomes a modern artist.

Each game round is a competition of trying to depict your word using just several shapes. Players will also have to challenge their deduction, trying to guess what their opponents tried to depict.

Quick Rules.
• Each player takes 2 Word cards and secretly chooses one, the other is placed to the bottom of the deck
• The facilitator rolls dice and places them on the Shape cards
• Each player draws their chosen word using the shapes rolled
• The first player to finish takes the #1 token, the next player — #2, and so on
• The facilitator takes each player’s Word card face-down, adds random cards from the deck and shuffles.
Then he/she places them face-up near the drawing board
• The facilitator takes each player’s drawing face-down, shuffles them and places them face-up near the
designated numerated areas on the board
• Players match words with drawings. They secretly note their guesses
• The first player to finish turns the sandglass upside down. After the time runs out, no one can take notes anymore
• The facilitator checks drawings one by one and writes a number of players, who guessed right, on each drawing
• A player with the most guessed drawing gets the first Victory token. In case of ties, the winner is a player with the lower number.
A player can’t gain 2 Victory tokens during the same round.
• The second Victory token goes to a player who guessed the most drawings. In case of ties, the winner is a player with the most
guessed drawing. In case of another tie, it’s a player with the lower number.
• Players check the endgame condition. If it’s not met, the next player clockwise becomes the facilitator. The new round begins.

-description from publisher

5 exciting, action-packed STARPLAYER football dice games for 1 to 8 players aged 5 to adult! Score GOALS, PENALTIES, DEFEND and WIN CUP MATCHES by rolling 5 cool PENALTY DICE and  2 super-cool FOOTBALL DICE! Keep score using the Man Utd Score Pad or collect one of the 4 sets of 5 Man Utd WIN cards featuring Fred The Red to win the STARPLAYER CUP card! Be top of the League and win the STARPLAYER TROPHY card! HOURS OF GREAT MAN UTD FUN

Here comes of little city patrol. They were patrolling the beautiful cities every day. What happened to them? Maybe they can help to catch the thief who stole the bicycle, or to help the old lady find the lost kitten, or to help the child to pick up the balloon which was blown away by the wind. Behind all the work they did, makes this city become safer and more peaceful, day after day, little patrols have solved one problem after another. They have gained the admiration and love of the citizens while making the city more beautiful. All citizens call them Super Patrol!

The game starts with the  player who saw a police car on the street most recently. Players take turns in a clockwise order. The police car is moved to the next pedestrian crossing and stops to assist the person who needs help.

     Move the police car to next pedestrian crossing. Draw an event card and ï¬‚ip the sand timer over at the same time, look for items or suspects on the game board. Cover the items or suspects that have been found with the locate tools.
     If the task is completed when time runs out, players win the badges as instructed on the card. They are ï¬lled in on the honor list starting at the bottom.
     Collect all locate tools on game board , and get ready for the next round!


Draw one event card.
Green Card——Lost item
Try to look for as many  lost items listed on the card as you can. Cover each item found with a locate tool. When time runs out, you get the matching  badges.
Game End
When the police car reaches the “END”, the patrol job is done.  You win the corresponding rank according to the badges you have earned. The highest level that your badges reach is your rank.

—user summary

Vicious cunning wolf is one step closer to this beautiful and peaceful forest. Clever brave Wang emergency search and rescue team star collection, they will do our utmost to find all the forest trapped small animals, and they take home. This is a cooperative game, all the players need to work together to win this game together. We help each other, do not let these cute little animals fall into the clutches of the wolf's oh.
just now! Starting immediately!
game rules:


     dice: Throws with two dice, if dodecahedron dice a "wolf paw" pattern, the wolf before further.
     Placed clues: According to two dice and letters, clues to locate the position of the plate.
     Mobile search and rescue dogs, and get clues: Mobile search and rescue dogs based on the idea dice points, if the search and rescue dogs to move the plate to get clues clues plate.
     Spell intact animals and animal rescue correspondence: If you turn, you or a player with another clue plates can spell an animal, each player draws a card silhouette, flip the hourglass, to find the target animal.
     Search and rescue success / failure: Search and rescue success can be put together after the animals into the territory of the corresponding position, if it fails before the big bad wolf further.
     game over: When the players are leveling successful 10 small animals can win, if the wolf into the forest the game failed.


—user summary

Language learning in the child stage, the contents will learn Pinyin is also in the early education process needs to overcome the problem. Absorb knowledge from the game is very suitable for a child learning, learn the alphabet as well. "Wonderful to pinyin" spelling combine the imagination and, in a playful way with children unrestrained imagination into the world, let the children play school, learn and play, teaching and learning.
When the game starts, shuffle cards, face up to initials. First three cards open on the top, then turn a card face up on the bottom of the pattern.

Children need to see the picture on the card and say imagine a combination of words, a word must be included in any of the three initials initials turn card.

Although the rules of the game that is simple, but playing it was super fun.

why? As we go into the desperate really do not know what they will say words, words often pop out does not make sense, or is very far-fetched to link the word relationship. This test more imaginative games, play with it more funny. If there is a clown among the players, they really will not stop laughing.

But when we play to distinguish between "ch"with"c"The difference between this kind of initials. Like" bed ", and is" ch "contact can not and" c "linked together, oh. We like this for a long time never learned the alphabet adults, it is easy to confuse, parents teach the course have to be careful slightly

The Miles' Massacre is a stand alone expansion set which is fully compatible with all other versions of Devil's Run. It is all you need to play or can be mashed together with any of the other sets

A battle between the BritAttack and the Los Nigromates...who will win...who will even survive?

—description from the publisher

All the football (soccer) in a card game.

This is a card game where you try to have more goals than your opponent. The idea is to start by a draft of 12 card in the center of the table face up. Each player will have 6 to start with at the end of the draft.

You have 6 types of card representing a (or two) football action like :

     pass
     center


etc.

The the player will alternate playing card in a common pile in the middle, the card you play will dicdate which card you opponnent has to play next.
If he don't have the card, he will draw, play if possible.
If he still can't play you will continue your action by playing an other card.

An "unstop" shoot will trigger a goal. BUT wait you have to check the referee by flipping the first card of the draw pile and check if the goal is accepted.

In case of a fault committed (red card), then the player will draw the first card of the pile and get :

     yellow card (two yellow will remove you a goal)
     free kick (nothing happen)
     penalty (the opponent check the referee for the GOAaaaallll).


The end happen when the pile is depleted twice or at the end of the match if you use the app.

Panakizhi started life as a design challenge to see if we could design 3 fun games using a common set of pieces and game board.  Over time we experimented with, and discarded, a number of different ideas - streamlining game play to keep the games as simple yet challenging as possible.  With game times lasting 5-10 minutes each we feel that the 3 games presented in this set enable strategy players to always have access to a quick, tight, and challenging game wherever they are thanks to the compact and light design.

The three games are:

Vancanna

With only 12 pieces on the board the simplicity of its looks belies the strategy involved in winning.  Players are attempting to move 3 of their coloured pieces off the opposite side of the board, the catch being that if they can jump their opponent's piece then they must make that move - and doing so will cause the piece jumped to be flipped to their colour.  It may sound counter-intuitive, but the strategic use of forcing your opponent to jump your piece, and thereby losing it, can actually be advantageous as it could trigger a series of moves that see your pieces advancing across the board.

Talluka

This game is deceptively simple yet players can quickly find themselves with a limited number of optimal moves.  Pieces are slid across the board one space per turn, the catch being that they can only move if they are on the outside of a line and are adjacent to another piece in the direction they are moving so that they can push that piece as well.  Align 4 of your pieces adjacent to each other and in a vertical or horizontal line and you win.

Gopurrum

Gopurrum involves moving and jumping your pieces around the board as you attempt to make a stack of pieces 4-high.  Each time you jump a piece, or a stack of pieces, the top piece on that stack is flipped so that it changes sides.  Only your pieces, or stacks where your colour is showing on top, can be moved on your turn - and no move can end with more than 4 pieces being on a stack.  Players can shed the top piece of a stack to an adjacent empty space if the top piece is theirs, but be careful as you may also be helping your opponent.

—description from the designer

In Masters of Renaissance you are an important citizen of Florence and your goal is to increase your fame and prestige. Take resources from the market and use them to buy new cards. Expand your power both in the city and in the surrounding territories! Every card gives you a production power that transforms the resources so you can store them in our strongbox. Try to use the Leaders' abilities to your advantage and don't forget to show your devotion to the Pope!

Masters of Renaissance is a game with simple rules offering deep strategic choices of action selection and engine building.

—description from the publisher

WWE Dice Masters: Campaign Box brings your favorite legends to the tabletop, whether you're a fan of "Macho Man" Randy Savage or Bret "Hit Man" Hart there's something here for you. With more than a dozen different WWE superstars from which to choose, you'll have tons of options to customize your Dice Masters team to beat your opponents! Not only are legends like Bret Hart included, but so are the superstars of today like Becky Lynch, Asuka, AJ Styles, and Shinsuke Nakamura!

WWE Dice Masters: Campaign Box uses the same proprietary dice-building game platform seen in other Dice Masters games, and while this is a standalone item, you can mix and match dice and cards from various Dice Masters titles.

This card game is based on the concept of ‘Would you rather’ and is hugely successful in The Netherlands. It contains sixty tricky dilemmas and there is only one real rule: you HAVE to choose…

The game has cards describing bad situations. Pairs of cards are used to create dilemmas for the players. The game can be played in two different modes:

     Create dilemmas for the other players and make them as difficult as possible. Penalty points are awarded if the other players choice is not split evenly. The player with the fewest penalty points wins.
     Guess what your teammates choose and obtain as many points as possible. This mode also has a two player variant.

Maktkampen (The Powerstruggle) is a light card game where you and your friends collects points through playful challenges.

But below the surface another game is hiding, where all players secretly tries to influence the behaviour of their opponents using psychological tricks.

Maktkampen is a game that doesn't end when the cards are back in the box. Will you win by keeping your head cool and manage to manipulate your friends, or will you loose yourself when reality and game mixes together?

Be prepared for a laugh inducing, shattering and occasionally shocking experience, signed by Henrik Fexeus - Swedens most famous mentalist and psychological manipulator.

Rules in short:


     At the beginning of the game every player gets three cards numbered 1, 2 and 3 (these are used for different challenges), and five red mission cards of which three is kept and two is discarded.
     The player whose turn it is takes a blue challenge card and challenges an opponent. If the player succeeds with the challenge the card is placed face down in front of him/her as a point marker. If the player did not succeed the card is placed  at the bottom of the blue deck.
     Anytime during the game a player can follow the instructions on his/her red mission cards. The card is not revealed until the player succeeds with the mission and is then placed on the table as a point marker. Then the player draws a new mission card.
     Blue cards are worth 1 point and red cards 2 points. The first to get 7 points wins the game.


—user summary

Inside Man is a deduction game for exactly three players.  The players take on the roles of Detective Billy Meowth, Franky (a mafia boss), and Timeowthy (Billy's best friend).  Billy was working as an undercover agent for Franky, but his cover has been blown!  The game is devised by Franky as a way to weed out rats, but he was unaware that Timeowthy was Billy's best friend.

Billy and Franky are each given 10 cards, and the game lasts up to 5 rounds.  In each round, the Billy and Franky players will simultaneously play 2 cards face down to the table.  The Timeowthy player will inspect the cards and determine which players' cards have the larger sum.  Timeowthy will then reveal one of the two cards player by the winner.  Once during the game Timeowthy can lie and reveal a card player by the loser instead.

The game ends when either Billy or Franky has won 3 rounds.  If Franky wins 3 rounds, then Franky wins.  If Billy wins 3 rounds, then Franky chooses 1 round in which he accuses Timeowthy of lying about the result. If Franky is correct, that player wins.  If Franky is incorrect, Billy and Timeowthy both win.

—user summary

Welcome to The G.A.M.E.

You are entering G.O. Techs Artificial Military Engagement (G.A.M.E.). It was originally designed to test and train soldiers that G.O. Tech supplied the U.S. government. It is now a deadly obstacle course you can brave for cash and prizes.

Surviving the GAME is a sci fi survival deck builder. In Surviving the GAME you choose to be a Soldier, Biogene, or Cyborg. You then build a deck around that character to best help you survive the obstacles you face. Unlike most deck builders, there is a play area to represent where you are in the GAME. You may move forward or backward by the rules to earn rewards. Like most deck builders, at the end, the one with the most victory points is the winner. Unfortunately only those who live get to count.

—description from the designer

So you think you know family Guy? Includes 20 character cards. Hundreds of trivia questions. Braggin' rights with every win!

—description from the publisher

Dooda is a card game created for enthusiasts and advocates of the psychoactive drug cannabis (weed, marijuana, hash, etc.). It contains colorful characters, funny illustrations, and with the ultimate goal of getting you "stoned" or "high" (becoming under the influence). This is accomplished by collecting the 5 cards that are needed to win.

Game Objective:  Get Stoned...

This objective is achieved by the acquisition of the following 5 cards; one of each of the following: Cannabis, Rolling paper, Joint, Lighter and Stoned. The first person to "get stoned" is the winner.
A collaboration of the Japanese TV anime show "Yurucamp" and "One Night Wolf"

Battle Bodies is a board game where players use different body parts to build a team of battle bodies to face off on an alien arena.

Players represent new Nalit Battle Master recruits, out to prove themselves in the Nalit battle arena. The Nalit is an alien race, travelling through space and time, collecting samples of different life forms from various planets, and pitting them against each other in the Nalit battle arena. Their current focus is the human race, and this is bad news for the human samples collected for the next round of battles.

Each Nalit Battle Master is required to build the best army possible to face the army of the other battle masters in the arena. The winner is the last remaining Battle Master that can deliver a full battle body to the battle field.

—description from the designer

User Summary

The French version of this game differs from the Pocket Player set both in the contents of the box  and in the mechanism of the game.

While sounding like the rest of the versions for Trivial Pursuit: Pocket Player Set – TP's People, the French edition's cards are formatted in regular size (while miniature for the Pocket Player Set) and there are 200 cards (the Pocket Player Set has 240).   In this French version, the question is selected by the roll of a special die, while in the Pocket Player Set uses a spinner.

Both are Trivial Pursuit, both are a pocket version of the game, but the two items are actually two separate pocketified Trivial Pursuit games.

Primeval Clash is a fast-playing skirmish miniatures game set in a world where prehistoric creatures and historical cultures join together on the field of battle.

Lead an army of some of the worlds greatest civilizations, side by side with some of the greatest creatures to ever walk the earth (or fly). A unique play system draws the focus away from the traditional approach of using dice to determine if you succeed, and instead determines what you succeed at. In this game you allocate your rolls to actions of your choice. It is a subtle, but game-changing approach.

——description from the publisher

The object of Carmen Sandiego USA Junior game is to be the first to catch Carmen Sandiego four times.

Each player gets an ACME Detective card and a hand of Landmark cards. Spin the spinner and move that many states around the map. When you get to a state shown on one of your cards, show the other players, set that landmark to the side, and draw a new card.

The first player to collect four landmarks wins.

This version of the familiar Carmen Sandiego game is made for pre-readers.

Sandstorm is a 2-player, card driven, hex and counter format game on the North African campaign. The map covers the area from approximately el Algheila in the west to just east of el Alamein in the east, aka 'the Western Desert'. The time period allows a start when the Italians invade Egypt in September, 1940, and ends December, 1942, when the Axis were driven out of Cyrenaica. The game has 2 months turns and use larger counters, 5/8th of inch, a full campaign should take between 10 to 14 hours.

Sandstorm is a 2-player game on the North African campaign with the recommendation to begin play when the German intervened in March 1941. However, one may start as early as September, 1940; albeit subject to Mussolini’s directive to invade Egypt, amongst other starting dates. The campaign game ends when the Axis were driven out of the ‘western desert,’ Cyrenaica and Egypt, December, 1942; other ending date may be selected. Players assume the role of the ground commanders trying to outperform their historical counterparts with the focus on the operational aspects. You plan and execute the sweeping maneuverers or head-first assaults. You have to make some of the same choices, do you press ahead in the hopes of a quick victory or pause to establish your line of supply? 
You will be bedeviled by the same problems, supply, the need to rest and refit, terrain, and, sometimes, your own superiors. Victory is achieved by eliminating the other player’s units from the region, delaying the opponent’s advance, or inflicting more casualties and taking few casualties than historically occurred.

A design aspect is toward playability in a reasonable table space within a manageable time commitment. The game map is 22” by 48,” at a scale of 12.5 miles or 20 kilometers per hex and encompasses the territory from the border between Cyrenaica and Tripolitania, Libya, in the west to just east of el Algheila, near the outskirts of Alexandria. Each game turn represents 2 months of calendar time. Unit sizes are generally regiments for the Axis and brigades for the Allies. An 11 turn campaign, from Mar/Apr 41 to Dec 41, game takes between 8 to 12 hours.

—description from the publisher
A 94 page, full colour book containing all of the Bushido, Risen Sun rules. Packed with art and graphic examples to make learning Bushido, Risen Sun a fun and intuitive experience.

This is a small press published game focusing on space combat and expansion in a remote star system.

Players are sector governors of a region known as Alpha 931 which is 15 light years in diameter. Turns are three months long.

The game is reasonably complex and the systems are essentially those of a wargame, 1980's vintage. The rule book and charts are 16 pages long.

However, the system is intriguing and has many ideas that would not look out of place in a modern game.

The game revels in obscurity. There are no graphics, no designer is credited and there is not even an indication of where the publisher is based.

Production is basic and monochrome.

—user summary

DIY KIDS sold by HOMESCAPE is a series of escape room style educative puzzle games specifically for kindergarten and pre-school age children.

The fourth in the series is: "Pirate treasure" where enchanted map shows the route the group has to follow; at each island a quest awaits, and the sailors can only leave if successfully completed the secret ritual.

Children in groups of 1-4 (aided by an adult game master) solve a total of 9 varied puzzles to advance the story and achieve the final goal. The quest is expected to be completed in 60 minutes, and the team scores points for extra time left as well as puzzles solved without hints. The game comes with a game master guide to set up and play through the adventure.

—user summary

In åäººä¼, also known as The Legend of the Greatest Master, 3-4 players are training in archery skills.  It is a trick-taking game with 5 suits, each with 7 cards, and staggered values (e.g. 0-6, 1-7, 2-8.)  There is also one card showing a bow and arrow that serves as the start player marker.

Players must follow suit, and each trick has two winners.  The player that played the highest valued card overall will collect the cards, but does not become the start player for the next trick; rather, this honor goes to the player who played the highest valued card in the lead suit.

Players sort the cards they have won into piles by suit, always keeping the lowest value card collected in each suit on the top.  At the end of a hand, players are ranked and receive a number of points based upon this ranking.  The first criteria is collecting the most suits, and the second is having the highest sum among the lowest cards collected in those suits.  Additionally, the player who holds the start player card at the end of a hand is ineligible to score.

The game lasts a number of rounds equal to the number of players and the high score wins.

Our game is called Kooky Cooks. It’s a wacky educational card game that utilizes money math skills and introduces youngsters to exciting new foods in unusual dishes.  Kooky Cooks is a game that is easy for kids to learn and engaging for parents to enjoy. Our game is specifically designed for 2-6 players aged 8 and up.
 Players take on the role of a Kooky Cook. Racing to complete as many orders as they can, players scramble to earn the most cash before time runs out. Throughout player turns, customers continuously fill the restaurant and request bizarre dishes. In order to cook these dishes, players will need to play specific combinations of ingredients from their hands. Along the way players may find special ingredients that have game changing abilities ranging from gathering extra ingredients to kicking out customers.

—description from the publisher

A lone howl rises above the surrounding trees. It's faint but he can hear it. The long, cold nights have not diminished the bull elk's wariness. Too many winters have come and gone and the scent of wolf on the air is undeniable. The clearing ahead could provide much-needed food, but it's best not to linger. As his path leads closer to the edge of the forest, a pair of unseen eyes shine in the moonlight following each step, aware of the large antlers. She’s low and down wind, invisible to the lumbering elk. The rest of the pack draws near waiting for her lead. There’s danger in such a large prize but hunger drives every decision. Now is the moment. Another howl rises.

The Wild North is a two-player asymmetric game simulating the everyday struggle between predator and prey in the northern Rocky Mountain ranges. Whether you’re a herd of elk searching for greener pastures or the wolf pack after the scent of a straggler, each player will feel the tense conflict that arises when these species clash. Survival is at stake.

A game is played over three rounds called years and each year is made up of four phases called seasons. Within each season prey and predators will play cards and work towards survival by increasing their range. At the end of each year range is determined and whichever species has the largest range after the third year wins the game.

Les Guerres du Roi Soleil 1667-1713 (The Wars of the Sun King 1667-1713) is an Operational level board-wargame, which represents the first opportunity to play with a single set of rules, the five conflicts led by France under the reign of Louis XIV the Great.

The War of Devolution (1667-1668) - Spain’s non-payment of the Infanta of Spain’s dowry at her marriage to Louis XIV was used as a pretext for a war of conquest. This was the first conflict initiated by Louis XIV against a militarily and economically weakened Spain.

The Franco-Dutch War (1672-1678) - France wants to bring the Dutch Republic to its knees. This fierce commercial competitor, too tolerant as a state, opposes France’s expansion toward the Spanish Netherlands. This war for glory pitches against each other living legends of the Thirty Years War like Turenne, Condé et Montecuccoli. As a result of this conflict, the King of France earns the nickname Louis the Great.

The War of the Reunions (1683-1684) - Spain does not accept the annexation by France of enclaves and surrounding areas in the Spanish Netherlands, stating their boundaries were poorly defined by the international treaties ending the War of Devolution and the Franco-Dutch War. Vauban recommends limiting the territorial enclaves, leaning against the mountainous area and securing the enclaves by constructing strongholds; it’s a matter of turf.

The War of the League of Augsburg (1688-1697) - The Habsburg’s victory against the Ottomans diverted the Empire’s attention on the French territorial gains following the War of the Reunions. In 1687, Louis XIV wanted to transform the Truce of Ratisbon into a permanent accord and send an ultimatum to the emperor who refused. The German princes and the great European powers form an alliance to counter France’s politics of expansionism and religious persecution. France finds itself diplomatically isolated.

The War of Spanish Succession (1701-1713) - King Charles II of Spain dies with no descendants. The two principal reigning families of Europe, the Bourbons (France) and the Habsburgs (Austria), are both related to Charles II and claim the throne. The principal stake is the domination of Europe by seizing the enormous heritage of the Spanish Habsburgs. France is confronted with its fiercest military enemies: Marlborough and Prince Eugene of Savoy.

Maximise your resource points to recruit armies, build strongholds, lead sieges and battles and win glory points.

Will you be able to vanquish Montecuccoli, Eugene of Savoy or Marlborough with Turenne, Condé, Villars and impose the Sun King’s will?

The game includes :
• One 59 x 41 cm map
• 270 double-sided, pre-cut counters and markers
• A book of rules and scenarios
• Two colour player aids

—description from the publisher

The Coldest Winter is a card-driven block wargame about the military conflict between the Soviet Union and Finland between November 1939 and March 1940. The conflict is better known as the Winter War as it happened during an extraordinarily cold winter.

The game emphasizes military operations on a strategic level using block game pieces to obscure the information on the block labels to simulate the fog of war.

The game also has a political layer to reproduce the international atmosphere as the eyes of the world were fixed on the war. Both nations must keep an eye on their Morale status as if it falters, it may hinder their number of actions per turn.

In addition, Finland has to manage its dwindling resources as it was not prepared for a full scale Soviet offensive after just a few decades after the nation gained its independence and fought a civil war. The Soviet military on the other hand was not prepared to encounter such fierce resistance and to fight in such harsh weather and terrain. The Soviet Union has to reform its military to readjust to these matters.

The game revolves around two unique 45 card command decks, one for each player. Each command card has an event and command point value to activate units and perform strategic actions. Both players also have two special unique decks of 5 cards to represent the international support for Finland and the reformed military approach for the Soviet Union. Both special decks contain what-if scenarios in addition to historical course of events.

—description from the designer

Choose a Kaiju and take part in an epic battle. Destroy your opponents and show them who is the strongest!

In Godzilla Total War players choose one of 12 Kaijus to join the battle. They can use cards and special hits to eliminate their opponents faster.

Godzilla Total War is an easy to learn card game, quick to prepare and fun to play. It is ideal for large groups (up to 12 players) and for those who don't want complex games with long and complicated rules, but games that are easy to prepare.

—description from the publisher
